title: Electrolysis of Molten and Aqueous Solutions
subject: Chemistry

questions.question: What is observed at the cathode during electrolysis of concentrated sodium chloride solution using inert electrodes?
options: Bubbles of colorless gas that burns with a pop
Bubbles of greenish-yellow gas with a choking smell
questions.explanation: In concentrated NaCl solution, H⁺ ions are preferentially discharged over Na⁺ ions at the cathode, producing hydrogen gas (H₂) which burns with a pop sound.

questions.question: What is the half-ionic equation for the reaction at the anode during electrolysis of dilute sulfuric acid using platinum electrodes?
questions.explanation: In dilute sulfuric acid, OH⁻ ions from water are preferentially discharged over SO₄²⁻ ions, producing oxygen gas: 4OH⁻ → O₂ + 2H₂O + 4e⁻.

questions.question: Which product is obtained at the cathode during electrolysis of molten lead(II) bromide?
questions.explanation: In molten PbBr₂, only Pb²⁺ and Br⁻ ions are present. Pb²⁺ ions are discharged at the cathode: Pb²⁺ + 2e⁻ → Pb, forming molten lead metal.

questions.question: What is observed when concentrated copper(II) sulfate solution is electrolysed using copper electrodes?
options: Cathode increases in mass, anode decreases in mass
Blue solution fades at both electrodes
questions.explanation: With copper electrodes in CuSO₄ solution, copper is deposited at the cathode (Cu²⁺ + 2e⁻ → Cu) and the anode dissolves (Cu → Cu²⁺ + 2e⁻). This is used in electrorefining of copper.

questions.question: During electrolysis of dilute sodium chloride solution, what is the product at the anode?
questions.explanation: In dilute NaCl solution, OH⁻ ions are preferentially discharged over Cl⁻ ions at the anode: 4OH⁻ → O₂ + 2H₂O + 4e⁻, producing oxygen gas.

questions.question: What is the main application of electrolysis of molten aluminium oxide (Al₂O₃) dissolved in cryolite?
questions.explanation: The Hall-Héroult process uses electrolysis of Al₂O₃ in cryolite to extract aluminium metal. Al³⁺ is reduced at the cathode to aluminium metal.

questions.question: Which half-equation occurs at the cathode during electrolysis of dilute copper(II) sulfate using inert electrodes?
questions.explanation: In dilute CuSO₄, Cu²⁺ ions are preferentially discharged over H⁺ ions at the cathode because copper is lower than hydrogen in the electrochemical series: Cu²⁺ + 2e⁻ → Cu.

questions.question: What is observed during electrolysis of molten calcium chloride?
options: Silvery metal at cathode, greenish gas at anode
questions.explanation: In molten CaCl₂: Cathode: Ca²⁺ + 2e⁻ → Ca (silvery calcium metal). Anode: 2Cl⁻ → Cl₂ + 2e⁻ (greenish chlorine gas).

questions.question: Why is cryolite added to aluminium oxide in the extraction of aluminium?
questions.explanation: Cryolite (Na₃AlF₆) serves two main purposes: 1) Lowers the melting point of Al₂O₃ from 2045°C to about 950°C, saving energy. 2) Increases conductivity of the molten mixture.

questions.question: What would be the product at the anode if concentrated sodium chloride solution is electrolysed using carbon electrodes?
questions.explanation: In concentrated NaCl solution, Cl⁻ ions are preferentially discharged over OH⁻ ions at the anode: 2Cl⁻ → Cl₂ + 2e⁻, producing chlorine gas. This is the basis of the chlor-alkali industry.
